intro: Cnesmone philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine cnesmone, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
